log.content: Create me a website about 3d printers. Make it technical and informative, including information such as calibration, what process should be followed after changing filament etc. Add lots of detail and use a modern design language with the main color being orange. You should create multiple pages, but make sure the main page is available in index.html

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"index.html","content":" 3D Printers Guide

3D Printers Technical Guide

  • Home
  • Calibration
  • Filament Management
  • Maintenance

Welcome to the 3D Printing Encyclopedia

This site provides in-depth technical information about 3D printer operation, maintenance, and optimization. Topics include:

  • Bed leveling and calibration procedures
  • Filament change protocols
  • Extruder tuning techniques
  • Maintenance schedules
  • Common troubleshooting solutions

© 2023 3D Printer Technical Guide. All rights reserved.

"}

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"calibration.html","content":" Calibration Procedures

3D Printer Calibration

  • Home
  • Calibration
  • Filament Management
  • Maintenance

Step-by-Step Calibration Process

1. Bed Leveling (Manual)

  1. Heat bed to 60°C (for PLA) or 110°C (for ABS)
  2. Perform 5 test prints with different Z-offsets
  3. Adjust leveling screws until consistent layer height

2. Extruder Calibration

  1. Measure 100mm of filament
  2. Heat extruder to 200°C
  3. Extrude 100mm and measure actual length
  4. Calculate new steps/mm: (measured/100) × original steps

3. PID Tuning

Use M303 command in firmware to auto-tune heaters. Ideal values:

  • Bed: P=22, I=1.2, D=120
  • Nozzle: P=40, I=1.5, D=60
"}

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"filament.html","content":" Filament Management

Filament Handling Procedures

  • Home
  • Calibration
  • Filament Management
  • Maintenance

Post-Filament Change Protocol

  1. Heat nozzle to 5°C above melting point
  2. Retract existing filament 10mm
  3. Insert new filament and push 30mm
  4. Purge until consistent flow (2-3 minutes)
  5. Perform 5 test extrusions at 10mm/s

Filament Storage Guidelines

  • Keep in airtight containers with desiccant
  • Store at 20-25°C, 40-60% RH
  • Use vacuum-sealed bags for long-term storage
"}

function.name: create_file
